meanings.definition: Speak badly of or tell lies about (someone) so as to damage their reputation.
meanings.sent1: She was traducing her coworker by spreading false rumors about him.
meanings.sent2: The tabloids are known for traducing celebrities to sell more copies.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started traducing the cat to the other pets in the house, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: His jealous ex-girlfriend was traducing him to all their mutual friends.
meanings.sent5: The politician's opponents were traducing him with fabricated stories to sway voters.

meanings.definition: To expose to shame or blame by means of falsehood and misrepresentation.
meanings.sent1: The bully was traducing the new student by spreading lies about him.
meanings.sent2: The malicious article was traducing the company's reputation in the market.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child was traducing his little sister by blaming her for his mess.
meanings.sent4: The scandal was traducing the once-respected organization in the eyes of the public.
meanings.sent5: The false witness was traducing the defendant in court with fabricated testimonies.
